channel.title: Software on Juan Orozco
channel.description: Recent content in Software on Juan Orozco

item.title: Zune Software: FAIL.
item.description: When I bought my Zune, it was after careful research and investigation that I decided to purchase one.   I knew it was a device with huge dreams of being the number one portable media player.   I knew that the path to that dream was long and dangerous.   But I bought one anyway.   I did it because I thought it had the potential and the drive.

item.title: Software Thoughts: Art Rage 2
item.description: I am always on the lookout for cheap or free software that I can use for designing. Sketchup is great, but hard for me to get used to with my Autodesk background. Photoshop Elements is handy, but lacks some of the big tools found only in the full version of Photoshop. GIMP is pretty cool too, but it runs really slow on Windows (at least on mine it does), and I don't want to shut down and boot into Linux just so it runs faster. My point is there's pros and cons to everything in life.
